annotation: Tang Kristensen, in recording this rhyme, seems most interested in capturing aspects of Peder's pronunciation. The lament captures well the trials and tribulations facing the young boys and girls who were employed in the summer months as shepherds. Peder himself did not work as a shepherd; he worked in his youth at a mill.
danish_manuscript:
Dawen æ lang å Træskun æ tong,  Mælma
derne æ små å a hå få lomk å go tit
for a æw en hæsselståk ålder kan bestel 
nåk tile åp å silde i seng hier skul da
F. tin fa dræng. Hjorte drengens Hjærtesuk.
english_manuscript: The day is long, my clogs are heavy the sandwiches are small, and I have a long way to go often I get hit by a hazel staff I can never do enough early up and late to bed here the devil should serve as a hired boy The Shepherd's lament.
danish_publication:
Hjordedrengens hjærtesuk.
Dawen æ lonng, å træskun æ tonng, 
mælldmaderen æ smo,
å a hå få londt å go, 
tit for a ow en hæsselståk,
ålder kan a bestell nåk,
tiile åp å silde i seng,
hier skuld da Fanden tien få dræng.
english_publication:
The Shepherd’s lament:
The day is long, my clogs are heavy
the sandwiches are small, and I have a long way to go
often I get hit by a hazel staff
I can never do enough
early up and late to bed
here the devil should serve as a hired boy
